communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello This is Brianne Wilds I am Ryan Jason Brannon’s fiancé  his TDCJ number is 02306970 last year we had a video visitation and we did sexual content I don’t care so much for the video visitation but he is wanting me to go up there to visit him through the window with our daughter after his graduation on April 29th I’m just writing to see if it’s ok for me to be put back on the visitation list. Thank you for your time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brianne Wilds

title: Niles Police CSO N-Word Incident September 2020

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

On Tuesday, September 8, 2020, an email was sent to Luis Tigera, Andrew Przybylo, Danielle Grcic, and Steve Vinezeano with the subject line:
"Is this how your officers act outside of work?"

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

The email along with the video attachment associated with that email.

Please also include any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, investigative reports, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, etc.) created, received, FWDed, CCed, or BCCed by members of the Niles police department and other village of Niles department staff, including elected public officials, between September 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) regarding this incident. Please include all attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois lobbyists and lobbyist expenditures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140/1 to 11), I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a database of all lobbyists registered in Illinois from Jan. 1 2020 to the current data. I also am requesting a database of all expenditures for lobbyists registered in Illinois.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I request the entire database, including all fields and any documentation necessary to interpret the data. If there are fields that you cannot release, please provide all other fields.

I frequently deal with large data sets. I can accept the data in many formats and on multiple media. I’d be happy to talk with your database administrator to figure out the best way to format the data.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer LaFleur

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CPI Data team
